sen.j: 七代目 尾上菊五郎（しちだいめ おのえ きくごろう、1942年10月2日 -）は、日本の俳優、歌舞伎役者、歌舞伎の名跡「尾上菊五郎」の当代。
sen.e: Kikugoro ONOE, the seventh (October 2, 1942 -) is a Japanese actor and a kabuki actor, and the present head of the profesional name of kabuki, 'Kikugoro ONOE.'
Kikugoro ONOE, the Seventh (October 2, 1942 -) is a Japanese actor and a kabuki actor, and the present head of the profesional name of kabuki, 'Kikugoro ONOE.'
sen.cmt: Seventhとし、全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: Kikugoro ONOE, the Seventh (October 2, 1942 -) is a Japanese actor and a kabuki actor, and the present head of the profesional name of kabuki, 'Kikugoro ONOE.'

sen.j: 本名は寺島秀幸（てらしま ひでゆき）。
sen.e: His real name is Hideyuki TERASHIMA.
His real name is Hideyuki TERASHIMA.
His real name is Hideyuki TERASHIMA.

sen.j: 屋号は音羽屋。
sen.e: His stage family name is Otowaya.
His stage family name is Otowaya.
His stage family name is Otowaya.

sen.j: 来歴・人物
sen.e: Historical trail, personality
Biography and Personal Profile
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: Biography and Personal Profile

sen.j: 現代歌舞伎のスターにして、三之助の一人。
sen.e: He is a star in modern kabuki and also one of "Sannosuke" (three younger Kabuki actors).
He is a star in modern kabuki and also one of "Sannosuke" (three younger Kabuki actors).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: He is a star in modern kabuki and also one of "Sannosuke" (three younger Kabuki actors).

sen.j: かつては女形中心だったが、年を増すごとに男っぽさが強くなり現在は立役中心。
sen.e: He used to play mostly female roles, but as he got older, he became more masculine, and now he mainly plays "tachiyaku" (a leading male-role actor).
He used to play mostly female roles, but as he got older, he became more masculine, and now he mainly plays "tachiyaku" (a leading male-role actor).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: He used to play mostly female roles, but as he got older, he became more masculine, and now he mainly plays "tachiyaku" (a leading male-role actor).

sen.j: 家の芸の世話物を得意とし、特に江戸っ子・小悪党をやらせたら、現在右に出る者はいない。
sen.e: He was good at playing "Sewamono" (a play dealing with the lives of ordinary people) and especially when it comes to playing an "Edokko" (typical person from Edo) who's a small-scale bad guy, he has no equal.

He was good at playing "Sewamono" (a play dealing with the lives of ordinary people) and especially when it comes to playing an "Edokko" (typical person from Edo) who is a small-scale bad guy, he has no equal.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、who’s→who isに修正
sen.e: He was good at playing "Sewamono" (a play dealing with the lives of ordinary people) and especially when it comes to playing an "Edokko" (typical person from Edo) who is a small-scale bad guy, he has no equal.

sen.j: 「尾上菊五郎劇団」を率いて江戸歌舞伎の世話物を今に伝えるなど、演技以外の活動も盛んである。
sen.e: Apart from acting, he also commits himself to activities such as laeding 'Kikugoro ONOE theatrical company' to pass down Sewamono of "Edo Kabuki" (kabuki of old Tokyo).
Apart from acting, he also commits himself to activities such as laeding 'Kikugoro ONOE theatrical company' to pass down Sewamono of "Edo Kabuki" (kabuki of old Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: Apart from acting, he also commits himself to activities such as laeding 'Kikugoro ONOE theatrical company' to pass down Sewamono of "Edo Kabuki" (kabuki of old Tokyo).

sen.j: またその端正な顔立ちから、日本放送協会大河ドラマ『源義経 (NHK大河ドラマ)』（1966/昭和41年）を当時最年少で主演し大人気を博した。
sen.e: H also gained much popularity when he stared in "Minamoto no Yoshitsune (NHK Historical drama)" as the youngest actor ever at that time in 1966, thanks to his fine-featured face.
H also gained much popularity when he stared in "Minamoto no Yoshitsune" (NHK Historical drama) as the youngest actor ever at that time in 1966, thanks to his fine-featured face.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: H also gained much popularity when he stared in "Minamoto no Yoshitsune" (NHK Historical drama) as the youngest actor ever at that time in 1966, thanks to his fine-featured face.

sen.j: このドラマで静御前を演じた富司純子と結婚。
sen.e: He married with Sumiko FUJI who played Shizuka Gozen in this drama.
He married Sumiko FUJI who played Shizuka Gozen in this drama.
He married Sumiko FUJI who played Shizuka Gozen in this drama.

sen.j: ファンに小泉純一郎がいる。
sen.e: Junichiro KOIZUMI is his fan.
Junichiro KOIZUMI is his fan.
Junichiro KOIZUMI is his fan.

sen.j: 長女は、女優の寺島しのぶ、長男は、歌舞伎俳優の尾上菊之助 (5代目)。
sen.e: His daughter is an actress, Shinobu TERASHIMA, and his son is a kabuki actor, Kikunosuke ONOE (the fifth).
His daughter is an actress, Shinobu TERASHIMA, and his son is a kabuki actor, Kikunosuke ONOE (the Fifth).
His daughter is an actress, Shinobu TERASHIMA, and his son is a kabuki actor, Kikunosuke ONOE (the Fifth).

tit.e: Chronological list of the main events
Chronological list of the main events
Chronological list of the main events

sen.j: 1942年10月2日 東京都に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Tokyo on October 2, 1942.
October 2, 1942: He was born in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記法に修正
sen.e: October 2, 1942: He was born in Tokyo.

sen.j: 尾上梅幸 (7代目)の長男。
sen.e: He is the eldest son of Baiko ONOE (the seventh).
He is the eldest son of Baiko ONOE (the Seventh).
He is the eldest son of Baiko ONOE (the Seventh).

sen.j: 本名・寺島秀幸。
sen.e: His real name is Hideyuki TERASHIMA.
His real name is Hideyuki TERASHIMA.
His real name is Hideyuki TERASHIMA.

sen.j: 1948年4月 新橋演舞場にて『助六曲輪菊』の禿で五代目尾上丑之助を名のり初舞台。
sen.e: In April, 1948, he performed as "Kamuro" (apprentice of a high-class prostitute) in "Sukeroku Kuruwa no Momoyogusa" at Shinbashi Enbujo theatre, referred to himself as Ushinosuke ONOE, the fifth.
April, 1948: He performed as Kamuro (apprentice of a high-class prostitute) in "Sukeroku Kuruwa no Momoyogusa" at Shinbashi Enbujo theatre, referred to himself as Ushinosuke ONOE, the fifth.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記法に修正、Kamuroのクォーテーション削除
sen.e: April, 1948: He performed as Kamuro (apprentice of a high-class prostitute) in "Sukeroku Kuruwa no Momoyogusa" at Shinbashi Enbujo theatre, referred to himself as Ushinosuke ONOE, the fifth.

sen.j: また、 森村学園小学校へ入学。
sen.e: He also entered Morimura gakuen elementary school.
He also entered Morimura Gakuen Elementary School.
sen.cmt: Morimura Gakuen Elementary Schoolとしました。
sen.e: He also entered Morimura Gakuen Elementary School.

sen.j: 1965年5月 歌舞伎座にて『寿曽我対面』の十郎ほかで四代目尾上菊之助を襲名。
sen.e: In May, 1965, he succeeded the name, Kikunosuke ONOE, the forth, by performing such as Juro in "Kotobuki Soga no Taimen" (confront with the enemy) in Kabuki-za theater.
May, 1965: He succeeded to the name, Kikunosuke ONOE, the Fourth, by performing such as Juro in "Kotobuki Soga no Taimen" (confront with the enemy) in Kabuki-za theater.
sen.cmt: succeeded the name→succeeded to the nameに修正、統一リストの表記法に修正、fourthのスペルミス修正、頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: May, 1965: He succeeded to the name, Kikunosuke ONOE, the Fourth, by performing such as Juro in "Kotobuki Soga no Taimen" (confront with the enemy) in Kabuki-za theater.

sen.j: 市川團十郎 (12代目)や尾上辰之助 (初代)らと三之助ブームを起こした。
sen.e: He created Sannosuke boom together with Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 12th) and Tatsunosuke ONOE (the first).
He created Sannosuke boom together with Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 12th) and Tatsunosuke ONOE (the First).
He created Sannosuke boom together with Danjuro ICHIKAWA (the 12th) and Tatsunosuke ONOE (the First).

sen.j: 1966年 大河ドラマ『源義経』で主演。
sen.e: He played the leading role in a historical drama, "Minamoto no Yoshitsune."
1966: He played the leading role in a historical drama, "Minamoto no Yoshitsune."
sen.cmt: 「1966年」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: 1966: He played the leading role in a historical drama, "Minamoto no Yoshitsune."

sen.j: 1972年 『源義経』で共演した藤純子（東映・俊藤浩滋プロデューサーの長女）と結婚。
sen.e: In 1972, he married with Sumiko FUJI (a daughter of a producer at Toei Company, Ltd., Hiroshi SHUNDO) who co-stared in "Minamoto no Yoshitsune."
1972: He married Sumiko FUJI (the oldest daughter of a producer at Toei Company, Ltd., Hiroshi SHUNDO) who co-stared in "Minamoto no Yoshitsune."
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記法に修正、married with→married、a daughter→the oldest daughterに修正
sen.e: 1972: He married Sumiko FUJI (the oldest daughter of a producer at Toei Company, Ltd., Hiroshi SHUNDO) who co-stared in "Minamoto no Yoshitsune."

sen.j: 同年、長女・忍誕生。
sen.e: In the same year, his daughter, Shinobu was born.
In the same year, his daughter, Shinobu was born.
In the same year, his daughter, Shinobu was born.

sen.j: 1973年10月 - 11月 歌舞伎座にて『弁天娘女男白浪』の弁天小僧菊之助、『京鹿子娘道成寺』白拍子花子ほかで七代目尾上菊五郎を襲名。
sen.e: In October to November 1973, he succeeded the name, Kikugoro ONOE, the seventh, by performing such as Kikunosuke, the "Benten Kozo" (a thief) in "Bentenmusume Meono Shiranami," and Hanako, a "Shirabyoshi" (a women who plays Japanese traditional dance) in "Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojo Temple) in Kabuki-za theater.

October to November 1973: He succeeded to the name, Kikugoro ONOE, the Seventh, by performing such as Kikunosuke, the Benten Kozo (a thief) in "Bentenmusume Meono Shiranami," and Hanako, a Shirabyoshi (a women who plays Japanese traditional dance) in "Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojo-ji Temple) in Kabuki-za theater.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記法に修正、succeeded the name→succeeded to the nameに修正、the Seventh, Dojo-ji Templeとし、クォーテーション一部削除、半角に修正
sen.e: October to November 1973: He succeeded to the name, Kikugoro ONOE, the Seventh, by performing such as Kikunosuke, the Benten Kozo (a thief) in "Bentenmusume Meono Shiranami," and Hanako, a Shirabyoshi (a women who plays Japanese traditional dance) in "Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojo-ji Temple) in Kabuki-za theater.

sen.j: 1977年 長男・和康誕生。
sen.e: In 1977, his son, Kazuyasu was born.
1977: His son, Kazuyasu was born.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記法に修正
sen.e: 1977: His son, Kazuyasu was born.

sen.j: 2000年 日本芸術院会員に。
sen.e: In 2000, he became a member of The Japan Art Academy.
2000: He became a member of The Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記法に修正
sen.e: 2000: He became a member of The Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 2003年 重要無形文化財保持者（人間国宝）に認定（親子二代での人間国宝）。
sen.e: In 2003, he was designated a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) (His father is also a Living National Treasure).
2003: He was designated a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) (His father is also a Living National Treasure).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記法に修正
sen.e: 2003: He was designated a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) (His father is also a Living National Treasure).
